intro: Praravinia havilandii, commonly known as Haviland's prairie violet, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and pale purple flowers. This herbaceous perennial thrives in moist, open habitats such as prairies and wet meadows. It is often found in sandy or loamy soils and is adapted to full sun to partial shade. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
